title: Incorrect conditional require `tslib` for forced common chunk
body:
<!-- Please don't delete this template because we'll close your issue -->
<!-- Before creating an issue please make sure you are using the latest version of webpack. -->

# Bug report

<!-- Please ask questions on StackOverflow or the webpack Gitter. -->
<!-- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/ask?tags=webpack -->
<!-- https://gitter.im/webpack/webpack -->
<!-- Issues which contain questions or support requests will be closed. -->

The conditional require inside a common chunk (enforced, shared by multiple entries) incorrectly skips loading of `tslib` (not sure if it is specific to just it or more generic issue).

**What is the current behavior?**

``` js
// when it fails, __webpack_require__.j == 9554

if (!/^([29]705|1743|2509|5639|5911|9554)$/.test(__webpack_require__.j)) {
var tslib_es6 = __webpack_require__(333940);
}
// EXTERNAL MODULE: ./node_modules/react/index.js
var react = __webpack_require__(989526);
// [...]
// CONCATENATED MODULE: ./packages/.../SomeReactComponent.tsx

var SomeReactComponent = /** @class */ (function (_super) {
    tslib_es6/* __extends */.ZT(SomeReactComponent , _super);
    function SomeReactComponent () {
        return _super !== null && _super.apply(this, arguments) || this;
    }
    SomeReactComponent .prototype.render = function () {
        // [....]
    };
    return SomeReactComponent ;
}(react.PureComponent));

var SomeWrappedComponent = Wrapper/* Wrapper */.i(SomeReactComponent );

// CONCATENATED MODULE: ./packages/anothermodule.tsx
// [...]
```

**If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce.**

No reproduction repository, happens in our large monorepo. All optimizations enabled (apart from minimize).

<!-- A great way to do this is to provide your configuration via a GitHub repository -->
<!-- The most helpful is a minimal reproduction with instructions on how to reproduce -->
<!-- Repositories with too many files or large `webpack.config.js` files are not suitable -->
<!-- Please only add small code snippets directly into this issue -->
<!-- https://gist.github.com is a good place for longer code snippets -->
<!-- If your issue is caused by a plugin or loader, please create an issue on the loader/plugin repository instead -->

**What is the expected behavior?**

tslib is loaded for all runtimes/entries using the common chunk since it is required in module scope.

<!-- "It should work" is not a helpful explanation -->
<!-- Explain exactly how it should behave -->

**Other relevant information:**
webpack version:  5.3.1
Node.js version: 12.13.1
Operating System:
Additional tools: tslib@1.13.0
